reviewText: It's a classic on-rails shooter concept. Think Star Fox but without the furries and sci-fi. Problem it its so heavily optimized for the Occulus its almost unplayable without it.\nThat being said, its free! So there no harm in trying it. If you have an occulus give it a shot, but I won't recomend it otherwise.

reviewText:
All reviews are lies.
I'll go through this game simple and fast

+Actually very easy to pilot, all controls are done by mouse
+Looks nice
+Plays nice
+FREE
+Kills time
+Quick turorial
-Bad UI
-Cutscenes at beginning of levels makes control seem unresponsive
-No fullscreen
-No graphic options

Final score... 7/10.
I would recommend, mainly if you dunno what to do or are on a roadtrip and have a good laptop with you.

reviewText:
I understand that this game is for learning VR.

I used the DK2 for this review.
Unfortunately, the flying and aiming controls are handled by the same movement. That means you cannot aim at enemies while flying in another direction. This leads to you flying in the line of fire just to aim at your enemies, and dying as a result, when you're just trying to land a hit with the very weak weapons of your machine.

This also means that enemies on the ground can only be hit by looking up to fly up, then looking down to aim at them, consequentially flying into the ground just to take aim and shoot at them. You're more likely to pass missions by avoiding all of the enemies and their projectiles, and to not bother shooting anything.

The game looks 'decent' if not super basic, as is the music. There is nothing fun about this 'game'. I do not recommend anybody to play or try this. There are better games out there that provide a more interesting VR experience.

TLDR
1/10 Crash To Aim Simulator

End-----* selects mission ,oh it kinda looks hd and cool, *accellerates looks like flight simulator 87 and you cant move left or right,you move forward bouncing off of objects while being shot at from like 500 different locales,end up brutally decapitating a squirrel king in your backyard and buying a gun and playing call of duty at the local pre k while pouring melted cheese on yourself in a ritual inside a taco

reviewText: Looking down and seeing a fighter jet below me through the HMD was cool, but the way camera control is taken away during the mission start cut scenes as well as the change in camera during shooting are horribly nauseating and break the good use guidelines for momentum in VR. Potentially a fun game down the track if the issues are resolved.
